content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 5 to node 6 in the provided graph is:

5->7->4

Note that the path is shortest because it uses only three edges and avoids any cycles. If the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path would be:

4->2->3->6

This is because the original graph contains a cycle (edges [2, 3] and [3, 4]) and the shortest path would involve going through this cycle. However, if you swap the start and end points, the shortest path avoids this cycle and uses fewer edges.

The shortest path from node 6 to node 5 in the provided graph is:

6->4

Note that the path is shortest because it uses only one edge.
